acf.heading: Get a Viagra prescription online.
acf.first_paragraph: There’s many reasons for why you could be experiencing erectile dysfunction, like stress, anxiety and lack of sleep.

accordion.accordion_title: What is Viagra and how does it work?
accordion.accordion_intro: The generic brand for Viagra is Sildenafil. Sildenafil is a type of medication used to treat erectile dysfunction.
accordion.accordion_content: Viagra works by increasing the body’s blood flow to the penis. This makes erections more firm, and more likely to be adequate for intercourse.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the uses of Viagra?
accordion.accordion_intro: Viagra is a drug that is used to treat erectile dysfunction. Erectile dysfunction is a common condition for men, defined as the inability to get or maintain an erection that is adequate for satisfactory sexual intercourse.
accordion.accordion_content: If you think you have erectile dysfunction, you can speak to a doctor on Maple to see if Viagra is right for you.

accordion.accordion_intro: You can take Viagra as needed, and only once every 24 hours. It typically takes 30 to 60 minutes for the medication to start working.
accordion.accordion_content: Viagra comes in different dosages depending on what you and your doctor determine to be most suitable for your needs.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the side effects and risks of Viagra?
accordion.accordion_intro: Common side effects of Viagra include flushing, headache, and runny nose. You should always speak to your doctor before taking Viagra, as they will decide whether it is right for you.
accordion.accordion_content: To learn more about Viagra’s side effects, see their official website here.

accordion.accordion_title: What's the most important information I should know about Viagra?
accordion.accordion_intro: Do not take Viagra if you take any nitrate medications. Nitrate medications are used to treat chest pain (angina). A sudden drop in blood pressure caused by combining viagra and these medications can cause you to feel dizzy, faint, or have a heart attack or stroke.
accordion.accordion_content: This is why it’s always recommended to speak directly with a physician.

accordion.accordion_intro:
You should not take Viagra if you:

  • take medicines called nitrates (such as nitroglycerin)
  • use street drugs called “poppers” such as amyl nitrate or amyl nitrite, and butyl nitrate
  • take any medicines called guanylate cyclase stimulators such as riociguat (Adempas)
  • are allergic to sildenafil, as contained in Viagra and Revatio, or any of the ingredients in Viagra.
accordion.accordion_content: If you think you have erectile dysfunction, you can speak to a doctor on Maple to see if Viagra is right for you.

accordion.accordion_intro: Viagra is not available over the counter because it’s a prescription medication. If you believe you need a Viagra prescription, talk to a doctor about whether you could be experiencing erectile dysfunction, and if Viagra could be a good solution for you.

Viagra does expire. Typically, Viagra is considered expired one year from the time the prescription is dispensed. Five years from the time of manufacturing, Viagra becomes inert and loses all effectiveness. Taking expired Viagra is not dangerous, as long as regular dosage is taken. However, like many medications, it becomes less effective after it expires. Therefore, it’s not recommended to take expired Viagra, as it’s unclear how well it will work.
